spec.name: Eden Club Cinema
spec.description: Eden Club Cinema (Cin√©ma Eden Club) is a historical movie theater in Casablanca, located in the central, architecturally rich district. Like many of Casablanca's historical cinemas built during the mid-20th century, its architecture likely features Art Deco or post-war Modernist influences. It contributes to the city's rich cinematic heritage, though many older single-screen cinemas have either closed or struggled to compete with modern multiplexes.

timeline.title: Establishment Period
timeline.description: The cinema was likely established during the period of high demand for cinema in the Protectorate era (Approximate date).

access.comment: Status assumed open based on input, but many historical cinemas face closure.
